CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 31, 1959, p. A7, reads: "Odds - United Entertain - Officers and some committee members of Odds-United, a new civic club from 809-811 Whiteside Rd., staffed by Soho Community House, who sponsored a successful 'Family Night Hoe Down' in the basement of building 15 recently.  The program consisted of community singing, dancing, mashed potato contest and refreshments.  Shown standing, left to right, are Mrs. Rebecca Grandy, president; Mrs. Mattie Brozier; Mrs. Anna M. Williams, refreshments chairman; Mrs. Gloria Henry; Mrs. Helen Brown, decorations chairman; Mrs. Lucy Moore; Mrs. Arbutus Everett, secretary, and Mrs. Eugenia Lawson, program chairman. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Officers and members of Odds-United, from left: Rebecca Grandy, Mattie Brozier, Anna M. Williams, Gloria Henry, Helen Brown, Lucy Moore, Mrs. Arbutus Everett, and Eugenia Lawson posed in interior with jack-o-lantern and food
